recommendations: Abhinav Sahu “I am pleased to recommend Abhishek, with whom I had the pleasure of working closely. As a coder, Abhishek consistently demonstrated exceptional technical skills, problem-solving abilities, and a disciplined work ethic. His coding expertise is truly impressive; he approaches complex problems with a logical and methodical mindset, always delivering innovative and efficient solutions. His dedication to his craft is evident in the quality of his work and his unwavering commitment to excellence. In addition to his technical prowess, Abhishek is consistently professional and well-mannered in all his interactions. His disciplined approach ensures that projects are completed on time and to the highest standards. Moreover, his sense of humor and friendly demeanor make him a joy to work with, fostering a positive and collaborative team environment. I have no doubt that Abhishek will be an invaluable asset to any organization. His coding skills, problem-solving abilities, discipline, and humor make him a highly recommended professional.”

Vani Shrivastava “Abhishek is one of the most proficient learners I have worked with. Despite being loaded with work, he will make sure he makes time for his personal growth, keeps the team glued together and will also make sure that his friends in the team grow along with him. He is equally enthusiastic in the fun team meetings as he is on daily scrums. He is eager to learn and explore and that is what makes him stand out. Keep up the good work, Abhishek.”

projects: [{"title":"Query Optimization Through Indexing","start_date":"Jun 2020","end_date":"Aug 2020","description":"Self-implemented indexes of a mock RDBMSimplementation using B-Trees to improve queryperformance. Without the index, the RDBMS query isserved via page scan and with an index created the RDBMSquery is served via index seek leading to lesser numbers ofdata page loads from the hard disk and higher performance.ToolBox Used: Java."},{"title":"StackOverflow Tag Predictor","start_date":"Jun 2019","end_date":"Aug 2019","description":"Given a bunch of questions, the objective is to predict tagsautomatically related to the subject of the question. Themodels predict one or more than one tags based on thecontent that was there in the question posted onStackoverflow. Framed it as Multi-label Classificationproblem.ToolBox Used: Sklearn, NLTK, Numpy, Pandas, Matplotlib."},{"title":"Python openCV face and gesture detection."},{"title":"Quora Question Pair Similarity","description":"This project is about identifying which questions asked onQuora are duplicates.
